result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane T Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is held open.
AMENDED 05-02-2016:  Restitution is ordered as follows:  $25 payable to  J. T. Arborist and $3,467.74 payable to Peking Insurance.  Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 168 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Any outstanding financial obligations are to be paid as a Condition of The Sentence.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shane T Rose in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Kegel.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's father presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's girlfriend presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's ex-wife presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  18 Months.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
168 Days Credit.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Any outstanding restitution/costs/fines/surcharges are to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 19, 2018 at 11:30 am.
